citation.article-title: Bacillus hwajinpoensis sp. nov. and an unnamed Bacillus genomospecies, novel members of Bacillus rRNA group 6 isolated from sea water of the East Sea and the Yellow Sea in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Cells are aerobic rods, 0·7–1·0 μm wide and 1·5–3·0 μm long.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Growth occurs at 10 and 42 °C, but not at 4 °C or above 43 °C.
Growth occurs in the presence of 20 % (w/v) NaCl, but not without NaCl or in the presence of >21 % (w/v) NaCl.
Acid is not produced from stachyose.
DNA G+C content is 41·0 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic properties are identical to those of B. hwajinpoensis and are given in Table 1.
Strain SW-93 (=KCCM 41640=JCM 11806) was isolated from sea water from Baekryung Island, Yellow Sea, Korea.
